title: Update problems from TB pre-115 to 115. How to convert filterlists?
content:
On Windows, the updater from Thunderbird didnt update at all. You need to manually download the new exe and do it there, pretty weird.

On Linux, the Flatpak updates normally. But having a really old profile seems to break things, my inbox was gone from the "bundled folders" view, so I set up a new profile again (using the -p argument, this is non standard!)

So now: How do I export:

  • contacts
  • filters
  • accounts
  • set up calendars
  • custom local folders
  • local mails
  • ...

from one Thunderbird to another? This is not especially my problem, but its a general one and its important.

I simply need a way to export my filters, as I dont want to make them again. The rest is already done, except contacts, where I have no idea how they are actually used and it never worked for me.

Using the Flatpak from Flathub on Fedora Linux

title: New network calendar event, very slow to update on calendar view
content:
Hi,

I am using a network calendar (Thunderbird build-in, no add-ons) with "Offline support" installed on premises (NextCloud). The calendar works perfectly, updating network calendar as needed.

When I create a new event and press [Save and Close] button, the dialog box closes, but the event takes about 25-35 seconds to appear on the calendar.

When I delete the event it takes about 12-15 seconds to disappear from the view.

If the calendar is local (on the computer) the event appears immediately on the calendar view.

I presume that this has to do with the network update procedure. Is there a way (or an option) that would show the event immediately on the view and make the update on the background later on ?

My Thunderbird version is 115.1.0 (64-bit) installed on Microsoft Windows 11.

Thank you
creator: EmmanuelT

title: How to stop annoying "will no longer be hosted" uninstall alert on startup?
content:
This is a general question on TB behavior when a dev moves (or removes?) an extension from the normal addons.thunderbird.net repo to a different webspace, but immediately concerns a specific extension, ThunderbirdHTMLedit.

The author recently moved the official download location (to www.betterbird.eu/addons), and whether triggered by that action or some embedded code, an ultra-annoying popup now appears on each and every TB startup:

"Dear users, ThunderHTMLedit will no longer be hosted at addons.thunderbird.net. Please head to www.betterbird.eu/addons/ to install the new version. The extension “ThunderHTMLedit” is requesting to be uninstalled. What would you like to do?"

The only two options are "Keep installed" and "Uninstall." There is no checkbox for "Don't ask again," "Remember this decision," or "Never show this message again as long as humans walk the earth."

So is there a way to stop such alerts that won't break other things?
creator: FFnut

The add-on is Thundersort.

Suggestions welcome.

title: upgrade to 115 appears to have lost many of my POP3 messages
content:
I did a normal update to 115 and it seems to have lost most of my POP3 messages. They're not listed in the main TB window. Nor are all of my accounts. And the messages themselves don't seem to be anywhere on my computer. I'm using file per message storage. This is a disaster, because they're automatically removed from the server when I download them. Any ideas about how I might be able to recover?

I'd really like to go back to 112, because 115 has other bugs and is incompatible with import/export tools, which I've used successfully many times. But --allow-downgrade sends me to 78, not 112. I don't understand why a significant upgrade like this doesn't automatically provide a restore point for all of us who might need it.

Is there documentation available of the profile changes the 115 upgrade makes? Maybe I can restore a 112 compatible set of profiles by hand if I know what's been done.

title: Do not want next message selected after deleting/archiving
content:
Before TB115, I used a plug-in called "Deselect on Delete" that would result in no message being selected after a message was deleted or archived.

With 115, when I delete or archive a message, the next one on the list (or previous one if deleting the message at the bottom of the list) is highlighted and marked Read. This causes me to skip over the message, thinking I've already read it. Very inconvenient, can't imagine how it's not an issue to other users.

I've seen other solutions that suggest toggling F8 to hide the preview pane. However, the next message is still selected, but not marked Read. Upon toggling F8 again, the selected message is then marked Read, making this not an optimal solution.

I was tempted to revert back to an older version, but my profile is no longer compatible. Hopefully there is a fix for this.

Thanks! - Robert
creator: info9721

title: Unable to easily access "Description" field of calendar event in order to click on Zoom meeting links
content:
I am having trouble accessing the "Description" field of calendar events, which is making it difficult to click on Zoom links in the Description of the event. It seems like there are two things that could be improved that would allow me to access the Description more easily:

1. When I mouse hover over an event in the calendar, the description field appears and I can see the zoom link. However, if I move my mouse off the event and over to the zoom link, the pop-up window with the description disappears. If this description pop-up window could stay around when I move over to it (or perhaps if one single-clicks on the event, then this pop-up window could stay around), then one could click on the zoom event. 2. When I double click on an event, I can normally see all the fields of the calendar event. However, when the "General" and the "Attendees" fields are very long, then the "Description" field doesn't fit within the window, and I cannot find a way to scroll down to it. If one were able to scroll on the "event details" window, then I would be able to access the "Details" field and I could click on my zoom link.

If either (or ideally both) of the above issues have a solution, then that would solve my issue with accessing zoom links in the Description of events. I am a new user of Thunderbird, so if there's a feature or add-on that I'm unaware of that addresses the above issues, then I would be happy to hear about it. I wasn't able to find something on my own though. If there are any more details that I could provide to help describe my issue, then please let me know.

Thunderbird version: 115.1.0 (64-bit) macOS version: 13.4.1 (c)
creator: zachary.p.potter

title: Accent insensitive search
content:
Hi,

When filtering messages, searching address books, finding events through "Find events pane" in calendars, the searching is case insensitive but not accent insensitive.

Some people write text without using accents or forget to use accents. Therefore, searching text in mail messages, contacts or calendars becomes very difficult (or even unusable in some cases), especially when text is written in languages that use accents like French, German or Greek.

Can you please make search accent insensitive ?

Thank you
creator: EmmanuelT

title: Problems trying to un-ignore a thread
content:
Hello! I accidentally hit 'K' with a thread selected, and so got a message at the bottom of the screen saying that replies to the thread will not be shown. This is the same situation as in the now-archived question [[Accidentally pressed "K" on an email - can no longer find it|https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1380096]].

I'm now writing because I *was* able to select the option to display ignored threads described in the reply to the question above – so that I can, at least, now see the thread that I accidentally ignored without meaning to. But I'd like to actually fix the problem and un-ignore it.

I've read the support article on Ignoring Threads, but what that article describes – namely applying 'Ignore' to the same thread so that it toggles off to unignore the thread – isn't working. I also tried quitting Thunderbird entirely after doing that and then reopening it, but I can still only see the thread if 'view' is set to still display ignored threads; when I remove that view instruction, the thread disappears again.

Does anyone know if there's something else I should try? Or is this maybe a bug in Thunderbird that needs to be fixed? Thanks so much in advance!
creator: linegrandfather
